question: Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & -2\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{v} = \begin{bmatrix}4 & 1\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the dot product $\mathbf{u} \cdot \mathbf{v}$.

answers.feedback: Correct!
Incorrect. Recall that the dot product is the sum of the componentwise products.

question: Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}-1 & 0 & 5\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{v} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & 2 & -2\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the dot product $\mathbf{u} \cdot \mathbf{v}$.

answers.feedback: Correct!
Incorrect. Recall that the dot product is the sum of the componentwise products.
